The problem I have with most of NTR works is the weak character and/or story development. To be frank, it goes beyond the NTR genre: I've got myself skipping pages in a lot of others genres. Nevertheless, this is a good work but I've got the impression that the author had already written the end but couldn't think of a way to make the story reach it, and then he/she made some poorly choices that some of you already pointed out. Like the boyfriend that came out of nowhere in the end, almost a Deus Ex Machina, and the heroine making some idiotic choices, a commonplace in the NTR genre. I don't like when I can "see the strings" being pulled on the characters, it takes out the suspension of disbelief and instead enjoying the story I end up raging at the author.
